answers.answer: This is my fourth baby and its been great. I have only had one pregnancy that was miserable. I am loving being pregnant with this one.

3 more days and this whole experience has been wonderful!! I went on a walk with my fiancé today (yes I look like I'm about to pop) but another mom came up to me and said "I do not miss those days". I giggled and kept walking but I have enjoyed these pregnant days. :)

The pregnancy part of the last 30 weeks have been awesome. Its all the other crap that's gone on that has made me miserable, including not one but 2 car accidents in the last month. Thankfully my baby is ok after both. Patiently wait the next 68 days to fly by

My first pregnancy was amazing... I had preeclampsia for the last month so I was monitored a lot but this time around I've caught the stomach bug, have hemrroids and the starts of SPD so I'm not totally loving this one but when my little boy moves around or when my daughter lays on my belly and sings to him I forget any pain... its all in how you look at it. For me I just remind myself its not forever and the end result is down right amazing

I absolutely loved being pregnant!  And I had twins!!!   I had no issues, whatsoever, no swelling no high blood pressure, no bed rest.  I slept fine at night, and loved every kick and hiccup.  I only gained 29lbs.The last couple of weeks they did get heavy, and I was ready to deliver...but i honestly could not complain!I carried to 36+2.

question: Just wondering for those that are going down the home stretch day 36+ weeks. Has anyones pregnancy been a positive experience? You always hear stories of how miserable being pregnant is so just wondering if anyone's had a happy pregnancy thus far.
title: Positive Pregnancy experience?
